      • countPrimes

        public static int countPrimes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        the number of prime numbers in the list return 0 if list is null or empty IMPORTANT: you can (and should) use the helper method isPrime(int) from class MathService as MathService.isPrime(value_to_check)

      • containsPrime

        public static boolean containsPrime​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one prime number in the list, false otherwise return false if list is null or empty IMPORTANT: you can (and should) use the helper method isPrime(int) from class MathService as MathService.isPrime(value_to_check)

      • allPrimes

        public static boolean allPrimes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        true if all the items in the list are prime numbers, false otherwise return false if list is null return true if the list is empty (because technically, every item in the list IS prime) IMPORTANT: you can (and should) use the helper method isPrime(int) from class MathService as MathService.isPrime(value_to_check)

      • countSquares

        public static int countSquares​(java.util.ArrayList<Rectangle> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        number of rectangles in the list that are squares (you can, and should invoke, the instance method isSquare() in class Rectangle) return 0 if list is null or empty TIP: using the enhanced for loop will make your life much easier!

      • squareUp

        public static void squareUp​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        change each item of the list to its square. if list is null or empty, do nothing TIP: use set and get methods.
        Parameters:
        list - For example, if list = [3,0,-2,6], it should become [9, 0, 4, 36]

        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:

      • isUnchanged

        public static boolean isUnchanged​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        true if all items of the list are the same, false otherwise. return false if the list is null.

      • getSortedOrder

        public static int getSortedOrder​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        2 if the list is sorted in both ascending and descending order, otherwise 1 if the list is sorted in ascending order, otherwise -1 if list is sorted in descending order, otherwise 0 return 0 if list is null. NOTE: an list like {5, 5, 5} is sorted in both ascending AND descending order

      • isBalanced

        public static boolean isBalanced​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        true if the list contains the same number of positive (more than 0) and negative (less than 0) items. return false if list is null.

      • allDigits

        public static boolean allDigits​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        true if each list.get(i) of the list is a valid digit ('0' to '9'), false otherwise. return false if list is null.

      • containsDigit

        public static boolean containsDigit​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        true if at least 1 item of the list is a valid digit ('0' to '9'), false otherwise. return false if list is null.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Character> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        the characters of the list converted to a String. return null if the list is null.

      • getCopy

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getCopy​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        a copy of the array. NOTE: the list returned SHOULD NOT refer to the same collection that the list passed refers to. In other words if you update the values in the list returned, the values in the list passed should not change.
